page.title: 03Winchfield Area - History.
page.content: The isolated{Church of St.Mary}& the C.16{Court House}are on the site of the deserted{Medieval Village of {Winchfield.}Not far away,{St. Mary's {Church}&{Dilly Pond}mark the{Medieval {site of Hartley Wintney}(also see RELIGION).There are numerous timber-framed buildings in the area & from the C.18 there is the magnificent {'Old Rectory'}built of 'ragstone' & Caen stone from Brittany.{Winchfield {House,}also C.18 was built for the Beauclerk family.{Winchfield Hospital (closed 1984) was originally the workhouse. The{Basingstoke Canal}& its bridges in this area date from c.1794 (also see TOURISM). The former entrance to the{Dogmersfield Estate is marked by a miniature turreted tower or{'Pepper-Box'}&{'Old Thatch' was an estate cottage.{'Old Barley Mow {Farm'}was the former Canal-side Inn.
